description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6i72o","text":"iPSCs- derived neurons are particularly challenging cells for genetic screening. Hence we develop a protocol for lentiviral titration of mDA neurons where mDA neuronal cell suspension combined with concentrated lentiviral supernatant are added at different dilutions in 48 well plates. Subsequent centrifugation (spinfection) was performed to achieve high efficiency transduction.  The transduction efficiency is determined as a percentage of BFP- positive cells through FACS (Fluorescence Activated Cell Sorting).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"fan27","text":"Calculation for lentiviral titration for the virus can be found in the following link: https://www.addgene.org/protocols/fluorescence-titering-assay/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":87,"length":62}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":87,"length":62}],"data":{}},{"key":"22tmd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pc02","text":"Calculation of  MOI can be found in the following link: https://info.abmgood.com/multiplicity-of-infection-moi","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":56,"length":54}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":56,"length":54}],"data":{}},{"key":"aji5o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i6k1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arvqp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af164","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djbkl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9435ECBED69D11EEB9800A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/fluorescence-titering-assay"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AB04995AD69D11EEB9800A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://info.abmgood.com/multiplicity-of-infection-moi"}}}}

references.title: Biphasic Activation of WNT Signaling Facilitates the Derivation of Midbrain Dopamine Neurons from hESCs for Translational Use
references.authors: Tae Wan Kim, Jinghua Piao, So Yeon Koo, Sonja Kriks, Sun Young Chung, Doron Betel, Nicholas D. Socci, Se Joon Choi, Susan Zabierowski, Brittany N. Dubose, Ellen J. Hill, Eugene V. Mosharov, Stefan Irion, Mark J. Tomishima, Viviane Tabar, Lorenz Studer

status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.section: Day -1: Coating wells with Poly - L ornithine(PO)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"11pig","text":"Coat 500 ul per well in a 48-well plate with 15 ug/ml PO in DPBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day -1: Coating wells with Poly - L ornithine(PO)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"58epl","text":"Incubate the plate overnight at 37ºC with 5% CO2 and 20.9% O2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 0: Coating wells with Laminin and Fibronectin
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"atjbs","text":"Thaw Fibronectin and Laminin on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 0: Coating wells with Laminin and Fibronectin
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8bveh","text":"Aspirate 250ul of coated PO from each well of the 48 well plate and wash the wells with 1 ml of DPBS. Repeat two more times for a total of 3 x DPBS washes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dj1av","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cc4f6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5c9b4","text":"Do not let the wells dry out.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"2F741EBEBF994F7DACF25490D41C162B"}}}}

steps.section: Day 0: Coating wells with Laminin and Fibronectin
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3rshr","text":"Aspirate DPBS and add 500 ul of 2ug/ml Fibronectin and 1ug/ml Laminin in cold DPBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 1: Titration of D25 midbrain dopaminergic neurons(mDA neurons) with Lentiviral CRISPRi library supernatant
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6o8ls","text":"Thaw the viral stock on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 1: Titration of D25 midbrain dopaminergic neurons(mDA neurons) with Lentiviral CRISPRi library supernatant
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3v3t","text":"Prepare 15 ml tubes with 200000 D25 pure population mDA neuronal suspension (CD49 neg) with concentrated lentiviral supernatants in serial dilutions in the 48 well plate in the following manner.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h4ba","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a38q2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3k54","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bg5hk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ekji8","text":"Make sure to mix well by gentle pipetting. Change tips after making up each dilution. Titration was done in triplicates.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"A5F02884795749D7BC5F12AED799804F"}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0":{"0":"K"},"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_10":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","0_4":"","0_5":"","0_6":"","0_7":"","0_8":"","0_9":"","1":{"0":"_"},"1_0":"","1_1":"","1_10":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","1_4":"","1_5":"","1_6":"","1_7":"","1_8":"","1_9":"","2":{"0":"1"},"2_0":"","2_1":"","2_10":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","2_4":"","2_5":"","2_6":"","2_7":"","2_8":"","2_9":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center steps.section: Day 1: Titration of D25 midbrain dopaminergic neurons(mDA neurons) with Lentiviral CRISPRi library supernatant
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fntpi","text":"Aspirate the fibronectin/laminin coating and proceed immediately to the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 1: Titration of D25 midbrain dopaminergic neurons(mDA neurons) with Lentiviral CRISPRi library supernatant
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"893qb","text":"Add 200 ul/well for each viral dilution with the cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 1: Titration of D25 midbrain dopaminergic neurons(mDA neurons) with Lentiviral CRISPRi library supernatant
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"330ji","text":"To increase the transduction efficiency, centrifuge the plate at 300g for 20 minutes at 25 C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 1: Titration of D25 midbrain dopaminergic neurons(mDA neurons) with Lentiviral CRISPRi library supernatant
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5m5pl","text":"Incubate the cells at 37ºC with 5% CO2 and 20.9% O2 for 16-18 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"955f0","text":"Aspirate the viral supernatant media gently and immediately add maturation media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"734k6","text":"Return the plate back to the incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3sddk","text":"Aspirate the spent media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kc7v","text":"Wash the cells 10 times with DPBS to remove the viral particles from the mDA neurons.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dc2l0","text":"Note: The neurons are sturdy and do not lift off during the washes. However look under the microscope during the washes to avoid the neurons lifting off.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dtbhj","text":"Add 100ul HBSS +papain and incubate the neurons for 45 mins in the incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1c9rc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"mi7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ab3qi","text":"Ideally the neurons should dissociate as single cells.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"2E45A49CE091430786D57475B772E90F"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6r1lo","text":"Neutralize the papain with maturation media and collect the cells into 1.5ml eppendorf tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tq3n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ed35t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1gp3i","text":" If the neurons are still present as a sheet or have clumps, use a P1000 tip, pipette the cells up and down to break them into single cell suspension.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"8F11EB6D9AF94BD9980A37A3200881BB"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"flk34","text":"Centrifuge the cells at 300 g for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ffs1s","text":"Aspirate the spent media gently without disturbing the pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"18u3t","text":"Resuspend the cells in 300 ul of FACs buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"25d7","text":"Transfer the cells with the FACs buffer into FACs tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6jlpm","text":"Analyze the cells through flow cytometry to determine BFP positive cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hu74","text":"The MOI for CRISPRi screen was quantified as the 10%-30% of BFP-positive cells to ensure one gRNA enters one cell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39fhf","text":"Method 1: Calculating using dilution Factor","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ac5jd","text":"T= (NXFXD)/Vt

Where
T= Titer, (TU/mL)
N=Number of cells transduced
F= Fraction of cells with fluorescence
D=Dilution Factor
Vt=Transduction volume in mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rd6k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dqeb","text":"Method 2: Calculating using volume of virus","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dd6j8","text":"T= (NxF)/Vv

Where,
T= Titer, (TU/mL)
N=Number of cells transduced
F= Fraction of cells with fluorescence
Vv=Virus volume","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bqnk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jsld","text":"Detailed protocol for lentiviral titration for the virus can be found in the following link: https://www.addgene.org/protocols/fluorescence-titering-assay/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":93,"length":62}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":93,"length":62}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3261089DD6B411EEBA4A0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/fluorescence-titering-assay"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20unk","text":"For Perturb seq, to restrict the viral integration in such a way that one virus infects one cell, we keep the MOI between 0.1-0.3.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73tdj","text":"Calculating the virus volume, for MOI (0.1-0.3).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5q57m","text":"MOI=(T xVv)/N","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efth9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmmgg","text":"Where,
T= Titer, (TU/mL)
N=Number of cells transduced
Vv=Virus volume","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asvi9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"421qp","text":"Detailed protocol for calculating MOI can be found in the following link: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4nl1","text":"https://info.abmgood.com/multiplicity-of-infection-moi","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":54}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":54}],"data":{}},{"key":"5k62n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"97B348E3D6B411EEBA4A0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://info.abmgood.com/multiplicity-of-infection-moi"}}}}
